conclusion: Since the winter began, haze weather with visibility less than 100m has occurred multiple times in many places across the country.
During severe weather, two cars, Car A and Car B, were traveling in the same direction on a straight one-way road, with Car B in front and Car A behind.
At a certain moment, the drivers of both cars simultaneously heard a siren warning of an accident ahead and started braking at the same time.
The diagram shows the v-t graph for the two cars just before they would have avoided colliding.
Car A has an initial speed of 25 m/s and Car B has an initial speed of 15 m/s.
Car A's speed decreases linearly to 0 m/s at 25 seconds.
Car B's speed decreases linearly to 0 m/s at 30 seconds.

premise: Car A has a higher initial speed than Car B and both cars start braking at the same time.
conclusion: Car A will reach Car B due to its higher initial speed.

premise: Car A's speed decreases to 0 m/s at 25 seconds and Car B's speed decreases to 0 m/s at 30 seconds.
conclusion: Car A will collide with Car B before 25 seconds.

premise: The collision must occur before Car A reaches 0 m/s at 25 seconds.
conclusion: The collision between the two cars must have occurred at some point within the 20 seconds after they started braking.
